sections.content: Pottery content is mesmerizing—the transformation of clay into form is inherently watchable. Success requires capturing the wheel from multiple angles, dealing with a dusty/wet environment, and showcasing the meditative process. Here's what pottery YouTubers use to share their craft beautifully.

faq.question: How to protect cameras from clay?
faq.answer: Distance is your friend—use longer focal lengths. Acrylic splash guards help. Rain covers/sleeves for protection. Keep lens cloths handy. Accept some risk—pottery is messy.

faq.question: Best angle for wheel throwing?
faq.answer: Front angle is classic—shows form emerging. Overhead creates hypnotic content. Side shows height and pulling. Most successful pottery channels use all three, switching during edits.

faq.question: Audio for pottery videos?
faq.answer: Two approaches: embrace sounds (ASMR appeal) or voiceover everything (cleaner education). Wheel motor and water splashing are ambient. Many viewers find pottery sounds soothing.

faq.question: Lighting a pottery studio?
faq.answer: Consistent artificial light preferred—natural light changes. Soft, diffused light flatters wet clay. Avoid harsh shadows in the bowl interior. Multiple sources reduce contrast issues.
